column4: How do I find out if my computer has wireless or not? I'm not sure if Ubuntu is supposed to detect wireless 'cause I'm not sure if I have it or not, heh
It's a compaq presario v2000 ... I dunno if it comes with a wireless card =/
wireless can be a pci, usb or pccard device - I would do: sudo apt-get install lshw, then lshw|less to see what all you have
lshw may be on the install CD
hmm, not sure if the dapper thing uses the install CD anymore
lshw|less
/string
no. once you see stuff, hit /string
okay, what string am I looking for in the output of lshw ?
tacos
thanks, brb
I get "Pattern not found (Press Return)"
then there are no tacos in your box.  (
what is tacos ? Is that wireless?
no - sorry - I was kidding - tacos are .. mexican food
you were looking for something - I figured you knew what you were looking for
I have no idea what 'lshw' returns =-/
I would read the whole thing - it isnt that much
okay, but after I've read it, how will I know if it has wireless?
im guessing if you have it you will know
there was lots of stuff about 'bridges' and 'hosts', but nothing about 'wireless' :(
sudo lshw|xclip  middle click in  http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org
may have to install xclip, but if no connection, don't bother
find the part that says "-network" and then look up the product and see what it is
